website_summaries.verdict: It's the one to get if you are planning on building a deck. This jig kit will eliminate most guesswork and help you create a strong, sturdy build.
pros: Designed to make most deck-building projects easy with its variety of drill guides and spacer rings
Allows builders to drill perfect angles and depths
Features large, easy-to-grip handle and heavy-duty craftsmanship
cons: Owners used to doing free-hand work have reported that it is complex and time-consuming to use
Requires 1/4" spacing between boards, and works best with hardwood

customer_reviews.title: This tool made the job so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I had some 100 year old cedar barn siding boards that I refaced and cut to equal widths to use as a new deck covering and really didn't want to "deface" them by screwing the boards down through this beautiful material. I purchased this tool in order to mount the boards with the least amount of new holes and couldn't be happier. Not only does the decking look great, the tool made the job installing it just that much more simple to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Russ L

customer_reviews.title: Don't use their screws or driver bit
customer_reviews.text: The jig is a decent design and does a good job for pre-drilling Pressure Treated 5/4 deck boards. But for some dumb reason Kreg thought they needed to design their own screw head. Torx or Square or Phillips was not good enough for them. Every screw I drove with their special driver bit slipped the head while driving. I continued using their screws, but switched to a square head driver. If I hadn't bought a big box of their screws I would not have used them either. If I use this jig again. I would purchase Torx or Square or Phillips head screws.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel LaDuca

customer_reviews.title: Great look, time consuming
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I love the look of my new dock that I built with this system. I will admit, it is much more time consuming than traditional laying of boards. I have bad knees to begin with so spending the extra time was hard. Overall I think it is a worthwhile investment if you don't want the screws on the top of the boards. Gives a nice professional look. You definitely need to be careful that you don't overpower the jig. It is only plastic. I did also have trouble with the collar on the drill guide slipping until I cut a small notch in the driver so the set screw could sit in further.
customer_reviews.author: David Yenerich

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material that doesn't justify the price.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is a great one! The quality is not. Cheap cheap cheap all around materials & quality. I bet it costs them less than $5 to build. It's 97% plastic, cheap breakable plastic. The proprietory bit got stripped after literally a dozen screws. That's what really made me mad and decided to return the whole kit. Decided to build my own jig out of wood & metal tubing and use regular star bits & screws. Works great. I'd kept it if it was at least 50% metal & non-proprietory bits & screws.
customer_reviews.author: Ahalayan

customer_reviews.title: Has limitations
customer_reviews.text: I was using on custom 1x decking and wanted a small gap. Without a typical rounded over edge of a standard deck board I found the screw head and driver would nick the edge of the board. The drill and driver stop slips on the shafts as others have mentioned. I wrapped with blue tape and kept an eye on it. I think I'm going to switch to a different system on my next deck, as I want a narrower gap and this can't go narrower than the shims provided.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cheely

customer_reviews.title: Overall good system, slow as heck to use
customer_reviews.text: Overall good system, slow as heck to use however. If using the 1/4 spacers (you will need MANY more than provided in the kit) the shaft of the driver will sometimes leave a dent in the neighboring board. Used the drill for about 4 boards then quit predrilling since I'm using Alaska yellow cedar, which is fairly soft, the 2X screws do a pretty good job of drilling their own hole, and the drill head just disappears into it's hole. Do NOT over penetrate the board, because you're coming in from the side if you overpenetrate you'll actually shove the board over a bit and mess up your spacing.
customer_reviews.author: DaveH

customer_reviews.title: Good product with a few problems
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. It is slower than surface screws or nails because of the extra step of predrilling every hole. I like the look of the finished job without surface screws. The only problem I had is the collar that controls the depth of screws is held in place with a small set screw. This kept coming loose after several screws are set resulting in screws set too deep. The same problem occurred with the collar on the drill bit but less often. Kreg could easily solve this problem by milling a shoulder on the shaft to control depth rather than rely on a collar secured by a set screw. I used this on 2x6 redwood using the longer screws.
customer_reviews.author: James Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Get Jiggie!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. If you are building a deck this jig is a must. I found it easier to work two deck boards at a time. I also found it easier to fasten one side at a time. Then go back and do the opposite side rather than flip the jig from side to side on a board. I have people wondering how I fastened the deck boards. Even my local inspector was impressed by the installation. I recommend two drivers, one for the drill bit and one for the screw bit. Once you get a rhythm the installation goes fast. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patty P

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, pretty happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, pretty happy with the results. I knocked off a star for a few reasons. 1 - its a little big and some areas i was not able to use it. Against the wall, the bits are so long my drill was hitting the wall so it did not work in that situation. Doing steps... have to drill from only 1 side or under. Not the worst but still a flaw. 2 - it was a little pricey and the deck screw i was not happy with at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kawika

customer_reviews.title: Only works with their screws
customer_reviews.text: Using their drill bit and only their screws really is inconvient and costly. Project stops until you can get replacements from them at extreme costs. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dsk

customer_reviews.title: The drill guide and spacers worked great. Only thing I ran into was the screwdriver ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my deck putting down composite decking. The drill guide and spacers worked great. Only thing I ran into was the screwdriver stop always worked loose and stopped using it after a couple hundred deck boards. It still functioned well as the screwdriver part had visible marks to show the depth to put the screws in. The jig works well but you must put pressure on the jig to keep it in place. The feet pads happened to wear away before I finished the 12' x 28' deck but that didn't change its functionality at all. Deck looks great without having screw holes on the top and the decking is very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ouwerkerk

customer_reviews.title: This jig is an ABSOLUTE must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just finished a 14’x20’ deck and put down the 2x6 decking utilizing this jig. We put in well over a thousand of the Keegan Protec-Kote deck screws. I am in a wheelchair and this deck is my outdoor access during this quarantine. I am SO amazed at the result. The deck is rock solid and without the screws visible, it is gorgeous. The jig is more expensive than others, but as my grandad used to say “ build the barn right the first time.” Bite the bullet- buy the jig. You’ll be very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Nash

customer_reviews.title: Worked great....but...
customer_reviews.text: Don't use this with wood that will warp or is warped. The screw heads aren't enough to hold it from moving. Not the fault of the product, you just need to use good wood or composite for the best result. I used 2 screw guns, one with the drill and one with the driver for faster installation. The jig worked great as well and everything was very consistant.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!

It is easy to use, you just slide it down the board and screw in where needed. It comes with 2 sizes of spacers (red or blue) depending on which size opening you want between your boards. The screw goes right where it should be, no misses. Saves a lot of time. Comes with an instruction video. We'll worth the money.

customer_reviews.title: Kneepads should be bundled.
customer_reviews.text: This does what it says and I now have a prettier deck than if I had used face screws. But it adds a TON of time to the project and is a hands-and-knees proposition. I used pressure treated pine and I am not sure I would do it again. For composite or exotic woods it would be easier to justify the fuss. I am curious about long term holding also. So far it is solid, but the real review should be in 3-5 years after some season changes. Be careful about the depth stoppers as they can move. After a while though I stopped using the jig at all and just freehanded the screws.

The Kreg Deck Jig helps you get the deck you want, without any unsightly exposed nails or screws. Designed to work exclusively with 4/4 to 5/4 (3/4-inch to 1-1/8-inch) composite stock without machined grooves, the Deck Jig's specialized self tapping screws are driven at a precise angle into the edge of your deck boards so they stay hidden from view. An easy-grip handle gives you a secure hold with complete control, and hardened steel drill guides keep your specialized stepped bit and driver bit at the precise, optimal angle. For added convenience, spacer rings ensure accurate deck board spacing and three separate drill guides let you install deck boards in a variety of hard-to-reach areas.

Whether you're building a new deck or refinishing an old one, with the Kreg Deck Jig and a few simple tools you can create a beautiful and functional deck surface, completely free of exposed fasteners and painful splinters. Traditional concealed decking systems utilize awkward steel fasteners or thin plastic clips to hold your deck boards in place. The Kreg Deck Jig takes a more straightforward approach, creating an incredibly strong wood-to-wood bond through precisely placed self-tapping screws.


No exposed nails or screws. The Deck Jig's specialized self tapping screws are driven at a precise angle into the edge of your deck boards so they stay hidden from view. Whereas seasonal changes might force traditional fasteners out of place with time, Kreg screws stay protected safely below the surface.Three Simple Steps
Even better, securing a deck board with the Kreg Deck Jig takes only three simple steps--just drill holes, drive the self-tapping screws, and you're done.

Works with a Variety of Materials
The Deck Jig works best with composite materials, but it's also compatible with native softwoods such as redwood and cedar, along with certain tropical hardwoods like red balau, and ironwood. Please note: It works exclusively with 4/4 to 5/4 (3/4-inch to 1-1/8-inch) stock and is not designed for use with 2x material including 2x4s, 2x6s, 2x8s, etc.

About Kreg Deck Screws with Protec-Kote
This kit comes with Kreg Deck Screws with Protec-Kote. Designed specifically for use with the Kreg Deck Jig, these Protec-Kote screws feature three anti-corrosion layers which protect against rusting in a wide variety of decking applications.

And like all Kreg Deck screws, the ones included in this system feature a KTX #1 square drive to reduce cam-out, a flat-bottom head which resists splitting, and a self-tapping tip which drills its own hole as it's driven.

Lifetime Warranty
The Kreg Deck Jig is backed by a lifetime warranty.

What's in the Box
Deck Jig, 100 Protec-Kote deck screws, instructional DVD, 6-inch Deck Jig driller bit, 6-inch KTX square driver bit, three 5/16-inch spacer rings, three 1/4-inch spacer rings, two stop collars, one allen wrench, and carrying case.
